content: Hi all, I was wondering if there is an R5 branch for people working on software for the Connectathon (or anything built from the Connectathon-snapshot forward)? I didn't find one, and would like to be able to point people to one if there is. Thanks!

No, I haven't done that yet. Until the last meeting, I've built private nugets for those interested. Its not particularly hard, you'd have to drop the new structuredefinitions etc for R5 in the model/source directory and rerun the T4 templates....
I have no one asking me for it yet, but you could look me up and we can build one together at the connectathon if you want.

Thanks! I've talked to a couple of people who spent time merging in the changes manually and wanted to give them a better option. Since I haven't needed to build it yet, I figured it would be easier to ask over just playing with it until it worked :grinning:
I wasn't aware there was a snapshot branch for the connectathon.
Grahame did a snapshot of the FHIR spec on August 11th for it.
Um, was that you did do a connectathon snapshot I could create a dotnet client version against?

Bah, can't find anything in Zulip. In my notes, there was a deadline of August 11th to get all changes merged into the main branch "for the Connectathon". It is labeled from you (Grahame) in the first half of July to do a snapshot, but after far too long looking I cannot find the actual origin.
Apparently I am gas lighting myself, sorry for any confusion.
Ahh, it was from a call I was on - someone (did not note whom) said that was a deadline/purpose you set. Telephone at its finest.
:embarrassed:
I can provide a little bit of background (::searches for a bit...)

Deadline for locking down the draft R5 spec for connectathon
Will September Connectathon be based on R4 or R5?
Many seem to want to use R5, although many will still be R4.
MOTION to set the deadline as 8/11: Lloyd/Brian Post
VOTE: All in favor
